intro: Alismorkis lindleyana, commonly known as the broad-leaved water plantain, is a flowering plant species native to wetland environments in Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often floating or submerged in water. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically emerging from the water surface. Alismorkis lindleyana thrives in shallow, freshwater habitats such as marshes, ponds, and slow-moving streams. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems, supporting various aquatic life forms.
